abstracts.cdata!:
The Roads and Municipal Drainage Project
            for Belize aims to a) improve year-round traffic flows on
            the national road network; b) improve natural drainage and
            reduce floods and/or the impact of floods in the selected
            municipalities; c) asses the potential of private sector
            participation in road maintenance activities; and d) improve
            the management of the transport sector, including transport
            policy coordination among the different government
            ministries and agencies. There are four main project
            components. The first improves a road section connecting the
            Northern Highway to the Western Highway. The second
            component implements road maintenance by contract as part of
            a pilot project at one or more of seven districts and
            strengthens the maintenance department of the ministry of
            works and transport. It also finances technical assistance,
            vehicles and computer equipment, physical works, and
            supervision for a pilot project. The third component
            supports the improvement of the drainage system for selected
            municipalities. The fourth component finances technical
            assistance comprising studies, engineering services, and
            training staff at the Ministry of works and Transport.
